Valero RFP and Gas datapst Daren Tom Martin wanted me to send you this info regarding the Valero RFP that Janet has as well Gas data is on the Excel sheet RFP in the Word document has pipeline interconnects in Appendix D If you have any questions dont hesitate to call me thanks Larry Jester Enron Power Marketing Inc Phone Fax Original Message From Jester Larry Sent Thursday June AM To Wallis Janet H Cc Ahn Chris Subject FW Valeros Confidential Natural Gas Consumption Data Janet Im working with Chris on the Valero RFP Here is the data for Valeros gas consumption David Dyck at Valero did indicate that they would prefer one single supplier for the Corpus Christi facility in particular Thanks Larry Jester Enron Power Marketing Inc Phone Fax Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESCDyckDvaleroEcomE NRONcom Sent Thursday June AM To Jester Larry Buerkle Jim Subject Valeros Confidential Natural Gas Consumption Data Larry and Jim Thank you for expressing your interest in responding to Valero Energy Corporations Request for Proposals for natural gas supplies Please find attached a file containing daily consumption data for most of Valeros major facilities in Texas California and New Jersey Certain other smaller accounts such as Valeros asphalt plants in California and Texas are not represented at this time In lieu of daily data for these accounts Valero intends to provide summary level data in the near future Daily data for the Clearlake methanol plant will be provided at a later date when it becomes available In the meantime please refer to the RFP for the summary data and associated discussion regarding the market environment for domestic methanol production Please treat the provided data as confidential per the Confidentiality Agreement executed between Valero and your company Power use data has been sent via overnight mail As questions arise please send them to my attention Thanks Dave See attached file ValeroFacilitiesNatgasxls ValeroFacilitiesNatgasxls Larry Jester

Gas MeetingI had two very positive meetings this evening with Tom Martin and Jim Schwieger They are looking for a Carthage Hub physical trader Tom is planning on talking I think to Lavorato to discuss the details Its interesting because with the HPL sale now their physical guys are moving into an environment where they dont have an asset to trade around and have to be flat daily Gee I wonder what thats like Given ERCOT liquidity and vol I had to chuckle on the inside welcome to the real world I really appreciate your support during all of this Some bosses could consider a situation like this a slight against them and bear out their resentment personally or to others to stymie that persons movement You have been nothing but a class act in that regard and although I indeed would have liked a look at the STERCOT book I dont hold that against you In fact I dont even hold it against management Its no different than trading Just because someone smart is selling it doesnt mean it wont get bid up and run through them I am confident that wherever I end up I will be successful no different than any other time in my life I dont know another way The one time that I had some shortterm hardship last year you and I agree that I was sold too early and that too will become selfevident As I stated yesterday the end of this week looks to be the time frame where I will make my a final decision Thanks for all of you runderstanding Larry
SOLUTIA meetingsmith PST When Tuesday October PM PM GMT Central Time US Canada Where
QSE Services Meetingsmith PST Ed Baughman would like to call a meeting to discuss QSE Services in the ERCOT region regarding risks rewards marketing plans etc Please indicate your availability

ERCOT Industrials Meetingsmith PST Items to discuss XOM RFP TXIChaparral Steel RFP Greg please read XOM RFP and go over TXI interval data before meeting XOM wants everything and their mother priced up I dont recommend we do that and TXIs data has unbelievable swings Thanks

Gas Meetingsmith PST Doug I had two very positive meetings this evening with Tom Martin and Jim Schwieger They are looking for a Carthage Hub physical trader Tom is planning on talking I think to Lavorato to discuss the details Its interesting because with the HPL sale now their physical guys are moving into an environment where they dont have an asset to trade around and have to be flat daily Gee I wonder what thats like Given ERCOT liquidity and vol I had to chuckle on the inside welcome to the real world I really appreciate your support during all of this Some bosses could consider a situation like this a slight against them and bear out their resentment personally or to others to stymie that persons movement You have been nothing but a class act in that regard and although I indeed would have liked a look at the STERCOT book I dont hold that against you In fact I dont even hold it against management Its no different than trading Just because someone smart is selling it doesnt mean it wont get bid up and run through them I am confident that wherever I end up I will be successful no different than any other time in my life I dont know another way The one time that I had some shortterm hardship last year you and I agree that I was sold too early and that too will become selfevident As I stated yesterday the end of this week looks to be the time frame where I will make my a final decision Thanks for all of you runderstanding Larry

FW Joe DavisResumeHeres a guy I played football with that you guys should at least bring in for an interview Hes got plenty of previous experience and has been at some good shops Hes a guy that would stay for the year to year and a half like we were talking about Juan Hed add some much needed depth to night shift until he worked up to days In fact I think he went to the Austin trip last year hes AfricanAmerican about lbs He was at EPMC at the time See you guys tomorrow LJ Original Message From Franklin Warrick Sent Thu AM To Jester Larry Cc Subject FW Joe DavisResume Larry Joe Davis asked me to forward his resume to you to pass on to Dana or whoever the appropriate people are over there in yalls group He is looking to make a move from CMS Energy I told him I didnt know if they were looking for any schedulers or realtime people but you would know that better than me Check it out and pass it around for him Ill give you his home number He is looking for something ASAP Thanks Warrick Original Message From Joe Davis ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESJoeDavisCkillajoehotmailEcomE NRONcom Sent Monday July PM To Franklin Warrick Subject Hey Warrick Whats up man I was wondering if you guys were hiring in your Power group If you could put in a good word for me I would appreciate it Thanks Joe D Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at intlasp RESUMEdoc RESUMEdoc

ERCOT Cc the back office reminded me to tell everyone that ISO numbers need to be put into the Oasis line in Enpower Since he does the losses manually after the fact this will help him a lot Also the link to the Ercot intranet is attached below If you trade Ercot please add it to your favorites ISO messages real time load display info and a new realtime ATC calculator matrix are all there You guys are doing a great job backfilling KCPL and moving power across the tie when we have the transmission Sorry about the PL and Enpower being hairy when we do it As youve seen however when the spreads are there we are printing money Be careful also when putting in deals with regards to what book they go in This morning there was a Cinergy wheel in the Ercot book Its easy to mess up even for the veterns Richard somehow had a PJM financial deal in the Ercot book this morning that just coincidentally lost over Im not sure what comment to make on that one Thanks again guys the Ercot book is up over K for the month due in part to the job you guys are doing If you work the phones hard in Ercot there are always people to get between for solid spreads Late LJ
homonan

Todays MeetingThanks for the time today I enjoyed talking to you about your plans for East Power and the Hour Group I have been nothing but impressed with the caliber of people here at Enron during my short tenure and you are no exception Leadership starts at the top and I am encouraged that you represent this through your clear direction for the group and willingness to listen to the ideas and suggestions of your employees Thanks again Larry

my resumeApst Tom Thanks for taking the time to speak with me yesterday evening regarding the opportunity on your desk I am currently reviewing several internal opportunities and returning to my gas roots is certainly a consideration I currently work for Doug GilbertSmith our Long Term ERCOT trader and run the RealTime ERCOT book I believe you know Doug who uses Eric to help us lock in forward heat rates at times Doug is aware of my desire for change and he is discussing with Kevin Presto other opportunities for me to stay in power however I will look at all my option and be making my decision based on what I feel to be in the best interest of Enron and myself and my family Please review my resume and I would be happy to sit down with you to discuss my goals and why I am currently seeking a change For your convenience I have also included a copy of my performance review Sincerely Larry Jester

ERCOT Load Following You Get Em Cc Rogers Kev wanted me to summarize for you the information that I received from one of the industrials that we have been actively pursuing TotalFinaElf has about MW of ERCOT load at a load factor Doug very aggressively priced these guys due to two things contact had indicated that he was getting low low heat rate offers and our relationship with contact I used to trade gas at the same bucket shop with their head gas trader Last week Doug showed them load following band all congestion all ERCOT pancake charges et al TD only pass through Evidently that indication by customer wasnt blowing smoke we ended up middle of the pack Calpine and Reliant both came in with the same product converting the heat rate sub Calpine being the most aggressive By all indications Calpine is showing heat rates and Reliant at least for this customer Now whether that translates into equivalent pricing for all low meter high usage and high load factor customers we shall soon see given the amount of pricing we have out there In this case however looks like they are willing to give it up on the MTM book to get MWs out the door and have it to trade around realtime in the accrual book next year Regards Larry Jester Enron Power Marketing Inc Phone Fax

RE industrial load locationsOriginal Message From Dean Clint Sent Tuesday October PM To Curry Mike Jester Larry Subject industrial load locations Gentlemen I am in the process of putting together an ERCOT industrial load database It will be something that in the future will help us value load in Texas As you know one of the factors in determining price is location Could you please provide me with the locations of these customers so that I can correctly assign a CSC zone to them Airproducts Alcoa BOC gases Corrugated Services Larry Jester S SA Crown Larry Jester Reliant Huntsman Larry Jester Odessa Kinder Morgan Larry Jester W Synder Koch Larry Jester S Corpus Christi Praxair TotalFina Larry Jester Baytown Crosby LaPorte Seabrook I know this is a fairly generic list but it is straight from the ERCOT region list that structure keeps so hopefully it will be very familiar to both of you Thanks Clint
